title: The US Supports Russia on UN Resolutions Regarding Ukraine
summary: Amidst the Russian invasion of Ukraine, the United States has aligned with Russia in UN resolutions that refrain from criticizing Moscow. The development marks a significant departure from previous positions, where the US condemned Russia's actions. The UK and France abstained from the vote. The move is seen as a setback for Ukraine, which has sought international support to end the conflict.

title: SAG Awards Honor Winners in Star-Studded Los Angeles Ceremony
summary: The Screen Actors Guild Awards celebrated excellence in film and television during a glamorous ceremony in Los Angeles. "Conclave" and "Shogun" emerged as top honorees in cinema and TV, respectively. The evening's highlight was Jane Fonda receiving the prestigious Lifetime Achievement Award, recognizing her extraordinary contributions to entertainment and social activism.

title: Russia-Ukraine Conflict Marks Three Years since Invasion
summary: Russia's invasion of Ukraine has led to severe economic sanctions that have had a devastating impact on the country's economy. The UN estimates that Russia's GDP will contract by 8.5% in 2022, and the ruble has lost over 30% of its value since the invasion began. Western countries have also sanctioned Russian oligarchs and seized their assets, and many foreign companies have suspended or withdrawn their operations from Russia. These sanctions are intended to pressure Russia to end its war in Ukraine and to weaken its long-term economic and political power.

title: Presidents Trump and Macron Exhibit Past Camaraderie Despite Diverging Views on Ukraine Conflict
summary: At a White House meeting, President Trump refrained from labeling President Putin of Russia a dictator. In contrast, President Macron of France asserted that Russia bears the responsibility of aggression. The meeting's outcome highlighted the escalating tensions between the United States and Russia, and the divergent views held by the respective leaders on the conflict in Ukraine.

title: Russian Officials Remain Silent on Anniversary of Ukraine Conflict
summary: President Putin will refrain from attending the anniversary of Russia's invasion of Ukraine on Monday. His absence underscores the ongoing conflict, where Russia continues to face significant challenges under Putin's leadership alongside the Ukrainian government and its international supporters. The war has profound geopolitical and humanitarian implications, with Russia's invasion widely condemned by the international community.

title: Ukraine President Zelensky Marks Anniversary of War With Somber Reflection
summary: On the three-year anniversary of Russia's invasion, Ukrainians marked February 24th with somber reflection on the lives and infrastructure lost. Key figures included President Volodymyr Zelenskyy and Russian President Vladimir Putin. The invasion, a culmination of years of tensions between the two countries and their allies, has had a devastating impact on Ukraine, leading to widespread destruction, civilian casualties, and international upheaval.
